post.body: What about @ZeroNet with democratic functions?

It is needed in this social network (profile covers):
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/issues/44
Lets help make this discussion grow.

This "Follow" text needs be changed to "Subscribe" or something like. Follow is a function, but what is proposed in this menu is a different function. "Follow new followers" can get the user confused by thinking between it is follow the follower's activities or receive notifications for when receives a new follower.

One of the favorite phrase of "free"masonry is "good luck," and they say that when someone plans something or is creating a project. They have the power to disrupt every one person's projects, so they say that people need the luck to do projects.

Many nerds work for them to create terrible projects, including clandestine camera installations in the homes of simple people like you and me. Their symbol is the pomegranate, but it is not a symbol of "unity in diversity" as they say, but is a symbol of contradiction. And we can see that when helping them, nerds deserve to live. My goal is to fill your hearts with love, information and/or joy with good messages, and also to attract casual users from surface-web/clearnet. And also to use some of these profiles listed here as news network on some of my projects and to maintain close contact with those who like these projects through an official profile.

Scientists will in the future implant the power of human brains into ants. And what can this bring good to the human being as well as friendships? Negotiations. But how tiny beings can help the human being? Nanotechnology. Ants can build tiny computers (in front of our size) with the same power as our computers. So imagine this nanocomputer being scaled to its original size: much more power. How could we compensate for the ants? With slugs. Slugs are relatively easy to breed animals, and can feed several ants for quite a while.

@kskarthik: Hi. With all due respect and without wanting to be rude, but you started this discussion by stating that this is an deal. If you are seeding my blog, it was because you wanted to, this is not part of any negotiation. If you want to track my posts, you can continue to seed. If you do not want to, you can stop seeding because - actually - I do not want to seed your blog. You can gradually show in your profile more about what you think and do. Maybe I could be interested in and follow your blog, or even other sites you've created. It's a pleasure to seed/follow interesting things. I hope you understand. üòä
As for life can not be said, but in the case of communications and digital applications, yes. Of course with its own operating system and satellite systems.

@Mkg20001: I'll build NW.js/ZeroNet into RPM packages, because it will be a Open SUSE distro. The Screens' UI will load in kiosk-mode in NW.js, that will autostart with the OS and togheter ZeroNet. Also the NW.js will have the ZeroNet Chrome's extension.

@Mkg20001: RPM will be used only to load UI and Zeronet. The UI is what will use apps. The apps will be zipped and distributed in a decentralized store.

@Mkg20001: The Open SUSE based OS I talked about will be the DCRS OS. Sorry for not mention it.
DCRS will can be a BIOS substitute for load HTML5 WS (Work Systems, a evolution of Operating Systems), on new motherboards (don't exist yet), or DCRS can be a legacy OS for the PCs of today. My plan is that devices of future have DCRS "BIOS" built-in (PCs, TVs, Phones, etc).
@Mkg20001: When I add Node.js features, Screens will don't work well anymore in browser. My focus now is ZeroNet/ZeroMe, but I know my focus need to be DCRS.

https://github.com/copy/v86

@Mkg20001: this wont work for my purposes. DCRS will be part of a new generation in computing, using web technologies. About it, I dream with the day ZeroNet will change from Python to Javascript/Node.js+NW.js/Electron.

@Mkg20001: As I said, DCRS can be a "BIOS" for new hardware, or a legacy OS for the actual computers. Anyways, DCRS is a OS, and the concepts we have can change in the future:
BIOS > OS
OS > WS
Desktop > Work Ambient
